Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 09:46AM Boscoe wrote: I had bi-lateral mx w/reconstruction last Monday.  You will find that every person is different and every sugery is different, but my range of motion wasn't compromised as much as I thought it would be.  I'd read these boards and knew that the more I could get up and walk and move my arms the better I'd feel, and they were right.  My SNB side was numb for the first two days, that was it-I can lift it nearly all the way over my head.  My prophy side was the one I had a worse time with, I had a reaction to a nausea shot (used to big of a needle) and caused swelling and bleeding in the muscle.  I could use it very little and it didn't take long for my shoulder to start to stiffen up.  My advice?  Listen to these ladies, they know what they are talking about!
Posts.Title: range of motion after surgery rayhope karen1956
